name: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine
Reason: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine contains a piperidine ring as its basic unit, which has a melting point of 106°C. The presence of a chloro substituent on the phenyl ring may increase the melting point due to the increased polarity and hydrogen bonding capacity, estimated at +5°C. The hydroxyl group may also contribute to the melting point by +5°C due to the potential for hydrogen bonding. The carbonyl group may contribute an additional +5°C due to the potential for dipole-dipole interactions. Summing up these changes: Piperidine base (+106°C), chloro substituent (+5°C), hydroxyl group (+5°C), and carbonyl group (+5°C).
